items.title: DockYard: Senior UX & Visual Designer
items.content:
Full-time

(Boston, MA or remote)

DockYard is looking for a great UX and Visual designer to join our team.

The ideal candidate is someone who:

  • Can demonstrate a strong user-centric approach to their work
  • Has been part of the user research process in the past
  • Has previous client services experience
  • Shows strength in typography, color, and information layout

We value diversity and strongly encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

More about the job

We’re a design-driven software consultancy. We make web applications, focusing on Progressive Web Apps. Our projects can last between several weeks and several months. Many of our client projects are “greenfield”, so you’ll have the opportunity to define the core concepts that will have impact throughout the application and be built upon as the product grows.

Our designers work with the most innovative clients in the industry, and provide design leadership in collaboration with DockYard’s Engineering team. Designers don’t code their own HTML/CSS, but a familiarity with how the web is built is a big plus.

We are a fully distributed company, with the design team clustered around Boston. This is a 100% remote position as of now. Some availability to travel is expected.

Because designers start projects and communicate directly with clients and the rest of the team each day, we value writing and communication skills. We also help you develop these skills, and grow professionally in other ways: a conference / education budget, DockYard Friday projects, and internal training are all part of the deal.

Responsibilities

  • Work directly with clients
  • Gather project requirements from various stakeholders
  • Create visual assets to support product discovery: from rough sketches to user flows to wireframes
  • Create polished visual design layouts
  • Collaborate with HTML/CSS engineers to ensure quality and implementability

If this working style interests you, we’d love to hear from you! Individual applications only, please: we do not work with recruiters and aren’t looking to outsource work.

Job Perks: DockYard Fridays! One day a week, we switch away from client work. Instead, we teach ourselves something new, work on internal projects, and experiment. We offer full health, vision & dental benefits plus a 401K plan, send you to one industry conference each year, and hold regular company team-building activities.

Apply: To apply, please include:- your portfolio & resume- why you’re interested in DockYard specifically- what you hope to do with your career in the next 3 years

items.title: Modern Tribe: Product Designer
items.content:
Product Designer

Posted Nov 13

Modern Tribe
Headquarters: Remote

The Opportunity

Modern Tribe is looking for a talented Product Designer to join our team.

Modern Tribe’s Product team actively runs multiple products, including the largest open-source calendaring and events framework (over 7 million downloads and counting). We are looking for experienced product designers to help us improve the user experience for our existing products as well as help us develop new products already in the works. Our team needs a designer with a strong product mindset, willing to collaborate with development, marketing, strategy and QA teams to inform the product and user experience.

Above and beyond your individual talents, we’re looking for someone to join our team. We’re a very collaborative bunch, eager for feedback. The work we execute is the product of the team. If you’re excited about learning from others, and helping others – you’ll find a good home here.

If that sounds like you, get in touch.

Responsibilities

  • Execute design thinking tactics – write user profiles and flows
  • Execute within the entire design lifecycle including research, wireframing, prototyping, visual design and user testing.
  • Work with Product Strategists to understand challenges and define solutions
  • Work with the development team to realize designs, conduct design QA, and aid in interaction design

Personal Competencies

  • Extremely outgoing and friendly attitude
  • Strong communication skills
  • Experience working as part of a remote team
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented
  • Strong organizational skills
  • A methodical approach to all tasks
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Fluent English speaker

Knowledge and Experience

  • Expertise in UX and UI design for digital products
  • Strong Adobe experience
  • Engaged in design community, current on contemporary design strategy
  • Demonstrable history of digital product definition and design
  • Understanding of product development lifecycle
  • Competency in code – we expect a general understanding of how technology works
  • Passion for detail and standards

Bonus Points

  • Experience in content creation, marketing, and copywriting
  • Demonstrable history of designing and shipping products for web and mobile

Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).

Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY: Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL: Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS: It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE: Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.
  • A FREELANCER: This means that if you live within the USA, you will also maintain your own personal client list and that Modern Tribe will only comprise a portion of your total income. Regardless of where you live, you need to be already freelancing.

Inclusion

Modern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.

We come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80’s movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.

Everyday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.

Location

Work from anywhere in the US or Canada; if you are in Central or South America, let’s talk. This will be a 100% remote position.  If your working hours are in a timezone outside of the US range, but you work 4+ hours of overlap each day our team might be able to consider your application.

Compensation

Our hourly rate for this gig starts at $45-75/hr, commensurate with background, qualifications and experience. We often start our freelancers on a one time contract position (though we are always seeking long standing relationships with kick-ass people).

Apply for this position

http://m.tri.be/19sq

items.title: Web Designer (Remote, Europe) at C4Media (Bucharest, Romania) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent

Job description

Overview

A rare opportunity to leave your creative mark on a global, highly successful company. Help us design, shape and grow our industry-leading brands ranked 5252 of all global websites, and events on 4 continents serving over 6000 attendees a year.

C4Media is looking for an experienced Web Designer / Frontend Developer with a passion for user interfaces and frontend technologies.


You will work with stakeholders, product managers and engineers to bring web projects to life from the concept phase and to implement them using clean, performant HTML / CSS / JS.


Check out our Dev Team and learn about why they like working for C4Media https://vimeo.com/184862499

Responsibilities
  • Working closely with stakeholders, product managers and engineers in an iterative and feedback-driven process, to design and implement highly-polished, visual layouts and interfaces.
  • Creating wireframes and concept designs and coming up with effective solutions to multiple User Experience issues
  • Concept fresh ideas and turn them into brilliant design
  • Develop responsive layouts by writing clean, semantic code frontend code (HTML, CSS, JS)


Benefits


  • An awesome team of highly motivated individuals with diverse skills and background.
  • Operations in Canada, Romania, USA, China, Japan, Brazil, UK, Greece, and Argentina.
  • A competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Visit a new country every year while attending our company meeting
  • A 100% remote - work from home - team spread across 3 continents and a great company culture!

About C4Media

Software is changing the world. C4Media -provider of InfoQ.com and QCon conferences - is dedicated to serving the world-wide enterprise software development community with a place to track and facilitate change and innovation. All content published on the website and presented at the conferences is authored by industry practitioners. Our mission is to facilitate the spread of knowledge and innovation in the software developer community (since 2005).

InfoQ is a practitioner-driven global community serving the information needs of development managers, technical team leads, software architects, and project managers. Every day we create and share content in 5 different languages by developers for developers. With a readership base of over 1,000,000 unique visitors per month reading content from 100 locally-based editors across the globe, we continue to build localized communities.

QCon is a practitioner-driven conference designed for technical team leads, architects, and project managers who influence software innovation in their teams. QCon coferences are organized by InfoQ and they run 8 times/year in San Francisco, New York, London, Beijing, Shanghai, Tokyo, Sao Paulo, and Rio.

items.title: Product Designer @ HYP3R
items.content:
Product Designer @ HYP3R

2017-11-08 23:22

Description

About HYP3R

HYP3R is a real-time, location-based engagement platform. Our platform makes it easy for businesses to engage influential customers at specific locations on a personal level, in real-time. What excites us most about HYP3R is building a new frontier for brand communication, powered by timely, authentic engagement in the context of location. We are on a mission to make marketing efficient for businesses and delightful for consumers. That yin-yang has been our guiding light.

We are looking for some of the most talented people in the world to join our winning team; from data scientists to marketing hackers. Speaking of winning, we are on a roll. After graduating from Disney Accelerator and Techstars last fall, we have gained the trust of amazing partners including the leading companies in travel, professional sports teams and global brands. We recently won the NFL’s and TechCrunch’s 1st & Future competition at Stanford. We are a well funded, revenue-generating company with offices in San Francisco.

Your Role

HYP3R is looking for a brilliant Product Designer with a proven track-record designing meaningful products that delight users and deliver tangible value. You’ll work closely with our product and engineering teams to conceptualize, design and deliver useful and valuable functionality for our growing list of partners. From brainstorming the next great product innovation to tweaking pixels right before launch, you’ll be in charge of realizing broad concepts into simple and elegant experiences.

Responsibilities

  • Create user flows, wireframes, site maps, customer journey maps, and other tools to guide the product development process.
  • Collaborate with product managers and engineers to conceptualize, document, design and develop new product concepts.
  • Create high-fidelity mockups and work with engineers and product managers to oversee UI design implementation, while also serving as an advocate for design in strategic product decisions.
  • Develop comprehensive annotated design specifications and functional documentation for our engineering team.
  • Be an evangelist for UX and UI best practices and design excellence.
  • Work with engineering team to help develop UI pattern toolkits.

About You

  • BS degree in Design, Human Computer Interaction or related degree preferred.
  • 3 - 5 years of professional experience designing mobile and web applications, preferably at an enterprise or B2B tech company.
  • Exceptional portfolio of (shipped) creative product design that showcases your interaction and visual design talents.
  • Experience leading product design process, including proven expertise in wireframing, prototyping, visual design and user research.
  • Ability to think at a high level about product strategy and vision (not just 'how it should look' but 'what we should build’).
  • Ability to understand customer needs, motivations and behaviors and translate them into actionable deliverables.
  • Ability to move fluidly between user experience design, interface design, and visual design.
  • Self starter who thrives most when owning a project and running with it, rather than being told what to do.
  • Strong conceptual thinking and writing ability. You can communicate verbally as well as visually, and have great sense for copywriting and tone.
  • Obsessed with getting the details right and maintaining consistency.
  • Care deeply about delighting end-users with a simple and intuitive user experience
  • Ego-free, thick-skinned person who can take and give clear feedback.
  • Prototyping motion skills with tools such as Principle, Quartz Composer, Pixate, Framer.js or After Effects.
  • Front-end web development skills (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) a plus.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: FullStack: Product Designer
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

Our team has become renowned in our ability to bring creativity, expertise, and sound development practices to notable and ambitious startups. Our mission is simple: to build great products that propel our clients towards success.

We're looking for someone to join our team who loves designing and developing user experiences. You will have the opportunity to work alongside a close knit group of very talented designers, engineers, and product managers to build software that changes the world.

 

At FullStack you will:

  • Be part of a team that builds disruptive and distinctive digital products
  • Work with product managers, developers and client stakeholders to deliver exceptional experiences tof the end user
  • Effectively communicate user interaction through deliverables such as wireframes and prototypes
  • Wireframe and mockup user interfaces with your design application of choice or in the browser (when appropriate)
  • Design web and mobile application interfaces and interactions
  • Actively participate in design critiques/reviews and product discussions
  • Think deeply about the user experience and usability issues
  • QA the implementation of your designs

You're qualified because:

  • Your ability to design exceptional user interfaces is second-to-none
  • Mobile and responsive design/development is not an afterthought
  • You have a burning passion for providing a great experience to users
  • You're proficient in handcrafting HTML and CSS (particularly HTML5 and CSS3)
  • You can build out your designs
  • You know enough JavaScript/jQuery to build out your designs
  • You get things done whether you're working autonomously or in a team setting
  • Communication skills and the ability to explain your design decisions come naturally

You'll get bonus points for knowing a little something about the following:

  • Version control with Git
  • Experience designing for iOS and Android
  • CMS templating in WordPress or other CMSs
  • Experience with MVC frameworks such as Ruby on Rails
  • Familiarity with A/B testing
  • Ability to conduct user testing and customer interviews
  • Ability to create icons and logos in a pinch

If this sounds like a party to you and you want to work alongside an incredibly talented team on some awesome products, we want to hear from you! We are a distributed team and welcome the potential of working remotely. Please send us a current portfolio of design and code samples, and tell us why you want to work at FullStack. It also wouldn't hurt if you sent us links to your Dribbble and Github accounts.

items.title: InVision: Design Specialist - EMEA
items.content:
Design Specialist - EMEA

Posted Nov 2

InVision
Headquarters: Remote
https://www.invisionapp.com/company#jobs

We power design at the world’s smartest companies.

We're a workflow platform for digital product design and collaboration, built to overhaul the process that turns an idea into a product. Reinventing the end-to-end development workflow—with an emphasis on customer experience—means entire teams have the opportunity to hold digital design disruption in the palms of their hands.

That’s why over three million designers, product managers, marketers and other partners at so many of the world's most loved startups, agencies, & corporations use InVision every single day, including Uber, Evernote, Twitter, Spotify, Salesforce and many more.

If your goal is to do career defining work, we believe you'll love working here. Added bonus? We’re a completely distributed team!

We are looking for a designer with expertise in product design best practices, design process and the design tools ecosystem to support our sales and customer success teams as a Design Specialist for the EMEA region. You will play a critical customer facing role to evangelize a design centric approach at large organizations. As a subject matter authority, you will elevate our design conversations with external senior executives, and educate and train our internal InVision EMEA customer facing teams.

Ideally you are a passionate senior designer or design leader, someone who's knowledgeable with popular design tools and methodologies, have first hand experience crafting or leading a design system and enjoy sharing that knowledge with others. You also love to teach, share, solve problems. Maybe you write, blog, or have a podcast as you have ambitions as a design thought leader.  

What you can expect to be doing:

  • You'll be the resident product authority around InVision and the broader ecosystem of product design and collaboration technologies
  • Help drive awareness and adoption of new product offerings among InVision’s Enterprise customer base
  • Craft customer facing programs evangelizing and educating on the value of Design Thinking and specifically targeted to the C-suite of large corporations.
  • Develop customer facing content and materials evangelizing the power of design. This will include translating educational content and industry experience into recommendations for rituals, team structure, processes, tooling, etc.
  • Regularly attend in person prospect and customer visits, leading senior level conversations on digital transformation and design best practices
  • Partner with the marketing team on strategic content, event speaking opportunities, and community meetups to drive awareness of the InVision brand
  • Work closely with Product and Design Education teams to scale efforts programs and workshops for senior leaders.

About You:

  • Ideally 5-10 years experience as a product or design lead in a large enterprise
  • Experience leading digital transformation or design thinking programs across large organizations
  • Ability to deliver engaging presentations to senior level audiences with a focus on education
  • Desire to build and maintain a personal brand as a product design expert
  • Strong desire to take initiative; you flourish with change and comfortable with ambiguity
  • Passionate about being a founding member of InVision’s international expansion
  • Bias towards immediate action and results
  • Willingness to learn and adapt

About us:

At InVision, culture transcends space, with a team made of kind, smart people in more than 20 countries. By focusing hiring efforts on humility and talent, a family-like camaraderie naturally unfolds. You will have the opportunity to grow a career from your homes—or communal workspaces in mini hubs, where many InVisioners live. As a result, you can weave productivity into your lifestyle, with successful work-life integration making it possible to travel the world while spearheading an impressive career.

Apply for this position

Apply at: https://boards.greenhouse.io/invision/jobs/890296#.WftWvBNSyb8

items.title: NationBuilder: Designer
items.content:
Full-time

(New York, NY)

NationBuilder is seeking a designer to become a core contributor to the wide scope of design needs at NationBuilder, software and community for leaders.

Your responsibilities will include maintaining and elevating the NationBuilder brand, crafting delightful web experiences across our online properties, collaborating on product design, and taking a central role in the overall evolution of design at the company. This is a great opportunity to have your work seen and appreciated widely. You will report directly to the VP of Design.

The design team is based in Brooklyn, New York, but working remotely is a possibility if required.

NationBuilder offers everyone the technology and community infrastructure to lead people to greatness. Our customers range from political candidates and nonprofits to corporations - anyone building a community of people to make something happen in the world. To learn more about NationBuilder, read about our mission, beliefs and values.

We're looking for someone who:

  • Has considerable experience designing and building modern websites with a polished visual design, and has a portfolio to prove it.
  • Has experience coding responsive webpages in HTML and CSS, and a solid understanding of frameworks like Bootstrap.
  • Is highly proficient with tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, and Illustrator, and has a familiarity with prototyping tools like Marvel and InVision.
  • Has exceptional attention to detail.
  • Is humble, passionate about personal growth, and would rather be "better" than "right."
  • Proactively seeks out feedback and welcomes it as an opportunity to grow.
  • Is effective in communicating design decisions to design and non-design audiences.
  • Has a strong work ethic, a quick learner and is willing to work with a fast-paced team.

Job Perks: - Great health insurance- Yearly conference stipend- Unlimited vacation and sick days- Unlimited MTA card (if in NYC)- Work on something huge that really matters

Apply: To apply, tell us why you're interested in this position in 140 characters or less. Most importantly, include links to your portfolio with examples of responsive websites you've created, and your resume by emailing jobs@nationbuilder.com with the subject Designer.

items.content:
Senior Designer

Posted Oct 19

Aha!

items.title: Fuel Made: Web Designer
items.content:
Full-time

(Western North America)

A few years ago we (Fuel Made) were just a small handful of folks focused on building the very best ecommerce experiences on the web. Leading out with strong design is how we delighted our clients, and grew our agency. Our design-driven approach led to success, and opportunities we couldn’t have imagined.

Today, our clients are successful, established merchants with specialized shops and complex needs. The opportunity to service these clients is challenging and exciting.

We are seeking a web designer to join our small design team. In this position you will work with our team, and directly with our clients. You will be directing and designing the solutions we build. This is a serious responsibility, and an exciting one. Watching your hard work come to life as it progresses through the project life cycle, and then watching our customer’s delight as it impacts their bottom line is rewarding. This is why we love ecommerce.

A quick summary of your responsibilities:

Once a client comes on board you will work with them over several weeks on discovery, creating wireframes and user flows (both visual and written), style direction, and finally the visual design. You'll then shepherd all that design work through the development process.

This is where we’ll need your experience as a web designer capable of tackling big challenges with discipline and an understanding of what web design really means, and how thoughtful design can help clients reach their goals.

Candidate must haves:

  • At least three years of, specifically, web design experience 
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • You need to truly love doing UX work in addition to visual design work
  • Comfortable and experienced with the technical aspects and constraints of working with the web. This includes an understanding of RWD, and how HTML and CSS work.
  • Passion for all things web and design. You are abreast of industry best practices and evolution.
  • Willingness to do things The Right Way (especially when it's hard)
  • Easy and enjoyable to work with

Nice to haves:

  • HTML/CSS coding proficiency
  • Experience with ecommerce
  • Photography background

Why you might like working for us:

  • We choose our clients carefully.
  • Freedom to care about your work (we're focused on quality)
  • Freedom to own projects from a design standpoint
  • Freedom to focus and get really good at what you do (we're focused 100% on ecommerce)
  • We work reasonable hours.
  • The care we have for our clients is rivaled only by the care we have for each other. We are a tight-knit, professional team who care a lot about doing world-class work together.

Benefits:

  • Vacation: two weeks paid vacation plus 7 paid holidays, and we also take off the week between Christmas and New Years.
  • Remote work: Western North America is your office.
  • Health care benefits. 
  • Yearly retreat: Each year we all gather as a team for a week somewhere fun (and warm!) to connect, learn, and have a lot of fun together.
  • Tools: we'll make sure you have whatever software and hardware you need to do your job.

Location: We are a fully remote company, but you must be in North America, and located in the Pacific or Mountain time zones, available to work regular business hours every day.

items.title: UX Designer @ Modus Create
items.content:
UX Designer @ Modus Create

2017-10-12 14:41

Description

Hello Designer, does this sound like you? People describe you as a generalist, but you have your specialties. You could run a design project from start to finish, but you nerd out when it comes to a specific craft like visual design or ethnographic research. You also value soft skills. For you, over-communicating and project planning are essential to any project’s success. Selling your designs is second nature to you, because you design with intent. And pretty deliverables mean nothing to you unless you ship a product that moves the needle.

You design fast — keyboard shortcuts are your poor fingers’ best friends. You know when to lean on existing patterns and when to create something fresh. And you understand the difference between innovating and copying. To you, perfectionism is a dirty 13 letter word that has no place in design.

You accept that most companies follow a wonky design process, and that’s why they need your help. You believe that teaching is actually the perfect way to stay up to date on your craft. You preach that user experience is more than just what you see on the screen. The most frequent word in your vocabulary arsenal is “Why?” You’re as good at understanding problems as you are at solving them.

This is a contract role. It may be performed from a remote location. This role requires a level of effort estimated at 40 hours per week.

Your Responsibilities

  • Own the end-to-end design process for your projects
  • Facilitate discovery sessions with clients and stakeholders to define success, requirements, and strategy
  • Actually interact with customers to research their tasks, pain points, and emotions
  • Use research to inform feature prioritization. Translate research data into digestible deliverableS
  • Create interaction design patterns in the form of user flows, wireframes, full color mockups, and interactive prototypes
  • Sell your work — tell compelling stories when presenting deliverables to customers
  • Be comfortable in formal design presentations and impromptu feedback meetings with clients

Required Experience

  • You have a portfolio showing your design process for multiple digital products across different industries
  • You have worked in an agile product development environment

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 100 people in 26 countries in 6 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

Why Modus Create

  • Enjoy the independence to shape digital products
  • Never get bored. Work on different projects across different industries. Fitness, banking, corporate security, travel, real estate — you name it, we’ve been there
  • Build products that people will actually use. See your work in the app store, or in the hands of companies with thousands of employees
  • Collaborate with other bright user experience minds to shape a quickly growing user experience practice
  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to work remotely / telecommute
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech company? Let’s start a conversation.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

You must be willing to support most of business hours of our client located in GMT-4 / Eastern Time Zone of the United States.

Senior Product Designer @ LearnZillion

2017-10-08 03:36

Description

Location: Washington, DC or US-remote

DC local or remote full-time staff position for authorized U.S. workers. No visa sponsorship available at this time, sorry.

Help us create the digital curriculum of the future.

Our well-funded, fast-growing education technology startup is looking for product designers to help us create essential tools for teachers, students, districts, and parents. You will play a key role in building LearnZillion’s technology platform and shaping its future. items.title: Groove: Lead Visual Designer/Illustrator
items.content:
Lead Visual Designer/Illustrator

Posted Oct 2

Groove
Headquarters: All the places.
www.groovehq.com

Groove is a customer service software company, and we’ve spent the last five years building what we think is the best support email management tool on the planet.

And now, if you’re an extraordinary designer who believes in our core values, we want your help sharing our story with the 300,000 people who come across our brand each month.

As our lead designer, your job will be to take charge of all aspects of our visual identity, from our marketing site to our blogs to our courses and more.  

You’ll ensure that the design across all of these is delightful, effective, consistent and extremely usable.

Most of your work will take place on the marketing side, though you’ll also be asked to help with in-app design from time to time, as well.

We’re not just looking for someone to “make things pretty.”

Yes, you need to be an artist, and yes, your art will be beautiful, but that’s not the extent of the difference you’ll make here.

Your performance will be measured not in pixels or hours, but in the impact your work has on our business.

If that excites you, we should talk.

What’s in it for you?

  • Work with smart, talented people who deeply believe in you and the work you do
  • Build your skills as a growth-focused designer, learning rapidly how each move you make impacts the hundreds of thousands of people who see it
  • Work from anywhere in the world with an internet connection
  • Competitive salary, obviously

What you’ll work on:

You’ll work directly with our marketing team to:

  • Create best-in-class design every week that delivers massive value to our audience and drives growth for our business, including:
  • Marketing site design
  • Marketing site illustrations
  • A/B test variants for various pages on our site
  • Landing pages
  • Blog illustrations
  • Infographics
  • Educational content (e.g., online course slides)
  • Webinar presentations
  • Other marketing miscellania
  • Pitch in your expertise to help us meet various quarterly goals, like “improve conversions on page X”
  • Come up with strategies and ideas to keep pushing our design forward, and then own the execution

Key Requirements:

  • Extensive experience doing world-class design work that drives conversions online
  • Self-starting and communicative; we’re a remote team, and you’ll be responsible for doing amazing work when nobody is watching
  • Experience working remotely
  • Organized; our brand has a lot of moving pieces, and you’ll help us add more

If you haven’t already seen our blogs, check them out here:

  • Support Blog

  • Journey to $100K Blog

Before applying, take some time to learn more about our company, and especially our core values. They’re very, very important to us.

If this sounds like a role you’re excited to take on, email alex at groovehq with:

  1. “Groove Designer” in the subject line
  2. Your dribbble page (or other portfolio link)
  3. 2 ideas for how you’d improve our existing visual brand in the first 30 days
  4. Your favorite GIF and/or Urban Dictionary word

Apply for this position

Send the details above to alex@groovehq.com.

items.title: Probably the Best Front-End Developer Job in the World - The Interaction Design Foundation - (Anywhere) - FullTime
items.content:
• The Interaction Design Foundation (Anywhere)
  • Fulltime Job

    • Probably the Best Front-End Developer Job in the World

    IDF seeks a Senior Front-End Developer to shape the future of design education

    The Interaction Design Foundation is the world’s most prestigious community and course platform for user experience designers. We are a nonprofit organization with a mission to reduce the cost of design education around the world, and we do so by providing high-quality online UX design courses at an affordable membership fee. With tens of thousands of members learning from our courses, and hundreds of thousands reading our free educational materials, we’re one of the largest UX design communities around the world.

    We’ve spent the last 15 years building our community, and the last year rebuilding our course platform—based on a brilliant technology stack. And now we want you to help us build pure awesomeness in versions 7, 8, 9, etc.! If you’re a senior front-end developer with sublime programming skills acquired from 5+ years of experience, we’d like to work with you.

    This is a paid full-time position. You’ll be location independent and will therefore be free to work from wherever you want in the world. You will have regular video-based contact with your colleagues and will get to meet them physically on team trips (see below).

    Why you’ll want to join us:

    • You get to work in an international team where we truly and deeply care about great architecture, great code, great documentation, great tests, etc.
    • We love our codebase and that’s why we have zero tolerance for spaghetti code and technical debt. Code should be so well-crafted that you want to kiss the screen.
    • You will have uninterrupted concentration time every day to build pure front-end awesomeness and thus accelerate your learning curve. If you were to work at Facebook or Google, you would be constantly interrupted and only have 2 hours of uninterrupted “flow time” per day. That creates a slow learning curve. Working with us, you get a full 7 hours per day. Imagine what that will do to your mental muscles, to your learning and to your career.
    • You will help shape the future of design education which millions of people can benefit from.
    • You will work with the best developers and designers in the world. And learn from them.
    • You will have the ability to work from anywhere — as long as your internet connection allows you to have video-based contact with your colleagues every day.
    • You get to work with true perfectionists! The development team is a small, senior, and highly-powered team of 7 people: 4 developers, a visual/UX designer, a software tester/QA, and a product owner. They also get input/help from an additional 4 people – as well as from our community of tens of thousands of designers and front-enders who love to provide feedback. You can learn enormous amounts.
    • You get to meet up with the rest of the team several times a year at interesting destinations like a scenic Thai island, Dubai, Denmark, or the like. See the video about our company culture for more.
    • We have a focus on evergreen programming techniques and best practices, as opposed to the latest hyped framework. We’d rather hand-craft things ourselves than build our platform on a gazillion 3rd party libraries. Just ask Facebook: they know it sucks.
    • Our CEO is a programmer and you will therefore not have to worry about “management speak” in order to get your point across. Just let your awesome code “speak for itself” and you will earn respect immediately!

    What you will be doing:

    • You will take ownership and leadership of an ever-growing front end codebase where elegance and simplicity must be maintained and furthered – and where the evil forces entropy, bloat, and spaghetti must be fought back by your intellect and coding skills.
    • Helping us to build an online course that will teach millions of designers how to become front-end developers. This will hugely improve your skills and ability to communicate – and will prove to be an awesome challenge!
    • Helping us to build an online course for our members on the topic of Design Systems – bringing Front End Development together with UI/UX Design.
    • Creating animations that are not only beautiful, but meaningful and are features that add to the UX of our users.
    • Building upon our current front end style guide and coding guides, which let our back end developers use front end components with ease. You will build a “design system” that is extremely detailed yet also easy to navigate and use…. much like https://polaris.shopify.com/

    About you:

    • You love to learn and push your skills to new levels.
    • You have 5+ years of experience working professionally with OO + MVC (preferably web technologies).
    • You have an understanding of basic programming patterns and principles as well as a strong sense of good engineering and architecture.
    • You want to help us take our educational platform to the next level with front-end awesomeness: Animations, interactivity, social features, data-driven design, a better mobile version, “little big details”, and much more.
    • You want to help build a rock-solid and perfectly architected and documented front-end codebase.
    • You are truly ambitious, result-oriented, friendly, and you like to continually improve.
    • You are self-motivated and love to see tangible results.
    • You speak and write acceptable English – not perfect English, just acceptable – since you will be working with people from Turkey, England, Denmark, Russia and Brazil, among others.
    • It’s a plus if you have an experience with Typescript/Flow, any JS framework, and/or PWA.
    • It’s a big plus if you have contributed to open source.
    • It’s a big plus if you have worked professionally with at least one statically typed programming language like C, C++, Java, etc.

    About the technology stack:

    We believe we have an awesome technology stack and a great (and agile) development process to back that up (Scrum). You don’t have to be an expert in all of these things. The most important things are your programming skills and extensive experience from other projects.

    The technology stack is currently:

    • Modern JS stack: ES6, Babel, JS modules, module bundling.
    • BEM/ITCSS as our CSS methodology for modular, reusable, and very well structured code.
    • We support only modern browsers (IE11+).
    • A clean separation between front-end and back-end code.
    • PHP 7.1 where we use all the newest language features like type declarations.
    • A framework which has an incredible community support. The name of the framework is not important since we are technology agnostic.
    • MySQL 5.7 configured for the highest performance; Redis for our caching needs.
    • One of the best content delivery networks with tons of delivery points all over the world for lightning fast pages.
    • Nginx with HTTP2 enabled – and thus the ability to architect your JS code more flexibly because of the architecture of the HTTP2 protocol
    • Git and GitHub using gitflow.
    • Vagrant (with VirtualBox) and seamless CI and deployment infrastructure.
    • …and well… lots more!

    Want to join our team? Here is how!

    Please send an email to Rikke Friis Dam at rikke.friis.dam@interaction-design.org with the following:

    • Screener question: Please tell us why you want to put your heart, mind and hard work into this job.
    • Screener question: Tell us the 3 productivity tips/methods that work best for you.
    • A personal job application

    Apply as soon as you can – we’re firm believers of “the sooner, the better”. We’re looking forward to working with you!

    How to apply

• Decisiv (Virginia)

    Decisiv

    JOB DESCRIPTION

    Decisiv is looking for a Senior Product Designer with deep proficiency in creating user-focused interfaces with an Agile development team. Your work will be critical to the success of our product and as such is highly valued by the organization–particularly now, as we embark on a massive user interface update. You should be passionate about the user experience, with a track record of success with UX research and implementations that benefit the end user.

    Decisiv is a rapidly-growing industry leader in the asset management and service supply chain marketplace. Our size means you’ll have major opportunities to expand your skill-set and contribute in a big way to the future of our product. Accordingly, our Design team is a group of self-starters, eager to produce quickly and solve big problems for our customers. We’re agile, flexible, and autonomous, working remotely via Slack, GitHub, Jira, Confluence, and Zoom.

    The Senior Product Designer will report directly to the Senior Director of User Experience & Design.

    KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

    Demonstrate ownership and lead product design for a specific portion of our product, applying a combination of direction and styles approved by the Senior Director and a deep understanding and empathy for the core persona

    Mentor more junior designers within the organization, and encourage consistency and growth in the designs of the larger design team

    Collaborate with other designers, developers, and product management team members to determine opportunities to improve the product

    Design wireframes, user stories, user journeys, mockups, and click-through prototypes to communicate design solutions to engineering teams, internal stakeholders, and end users

    Advocate for the user’s total experience across all touch points; from the corporate website to the end users’ impression of the product itself

    Keep up-to-date about new and successful user experience techniques, share your knowledge on the latest trends and interaction patterns, and evangelize design-oriented thinking throughout the Decisiv organization

    Apply user research methods for identifying problems in the user’s journey, determine the best resolution, and aid in the design and execution of usability tests

    Contribute to the design of other collateral in support of the product, including our corporate website, white papers, template files, trade show elements, and more

    DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

    Completed studies in the field of Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Information Design, Interaction Design, Media Design, User Experience or similar programs, or equivalent work experience designing successful digital user-experiences

    3-6 years of work experience doing UX and/or product design

    Understanding of how to apply various user research methods to help define user needs and goals

    Detail-oriented design and communication; the tiny details make a major impact

    Experience designing wireframes and mockups using standard tools such as Illustrator, Sketch, and Balsamiq (or equivalent) to demonstrate design solutions that impact the user throughout their interaction lifecycle

    Experience with and desire to lead teams of designers

    Experience with mobile design patterns gets you some big thumbs up

    Skill with developing light-weight click-preview prototypes with HTML/CSS is a plus

    Interest and skill in developing data visualizations is also a bonus

    Ability to prioritize and manage multiple design projects, strong organizational and time-management skills

    People most qualified for this role will be:

    Curious – about the latest UX trends and interaction patterns

    Driven – to improve interactions across all user touch-points, from the beginning of their journey to the end

    Smart – learn our systems and our industry quickly

    Hard working – we are growing, and we’ve got a lot to accomplish

    Outgoing – we have a rapidly growing, global team, and you’ll be interacting with a lot of different people within the organization, so building relationships that allow you to work productively with those teammates is key

    Collaborative – we work as a team, and are firm believers that the best solutions are a team effort

    Organized – like we said, there’s a lot going on, so it’s important that your work is easily accessible, shareable, and streamlined

    PORTFOLIO

    Show us what you’ve got! We want to see your design experience, whether it’s a full-fledged portfolio, sketches, wireframes, prototypes, personas and research, or all of the above. Please send a resume and relevant work samples to careers@decisiv.com.
